citation.article-title: Actinobispora, a new genus of the order Actinomycetales

p.s: Description of Actinobispora yunnanensis sp. nov.
Actinobispora yunnanensis (yun.nan.en'sis. M. L. adj. Yunnanensis, pertaining to Yunnan, a province of south China)
Aerial mycelium is sparse and white.
The spores are borne in longitudinal pairs on vegetative hyphae and in single or in longitudinal pairs on aerial hyphae.
Neither diffusible pigment nor melanin is produced.
Utilizes glucose, arabinose, rhamnose, glycerol, inositol, and proline but does not produce acid from these carbon sources.
No growth on inulin and histidine.
Milk is coagulated and peptonized; nitrate is reduced.
No gelatin liquefaction, hydrolysis of starch, or production of hydrogen sulfide.
Guanine-plus-cytosine content of DNA is 71.0 mol% (determined by the thermal denaturation method).
The type strain is CCTCC M 90959 (Y-11981).
